As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions, but here are some ways parents can encourage their kids to get involved in fundraising activities to support a meaningful cause:

1. Identify a cause: Explain to your child about various causes and why they matter. Involve them in selecting an organization or cause that aligns with their values.

2. Educate: Teach your child about the impact of fundraising and how it can benefit the chosen cause. You can also discuss the organization's mission, its projects, and the people it helps.

3. Set a goal: Encourage your child to set a fundraising goal and come up with creative ways to achieve it. It could be organizing a bake sale, car wash, or creating a GoFundMe page.

4. Lead by example: Volunteer or donate to the cause yourself. Your child will be more inspired by seeing you actively contribute to the cause.

5. Encourage teamwork: Encourage your child to get their friends involved in the fundraising activity. It's a great way to build their team building, leadership, and communication skills.

6. Celebrate achievements: Celebrate any milestones and achievements done by your child and acknowledge their hard work.

7. Follow up: After the fundraising event or activity, follow up with your child about how much was donated and where it went. It is essential to show your child the positive impact that their efforts have made in helping others.
